_header: Saint Augustine that Christendom brought into England
Subjects: saints’ lives; Augustine of Canterbury, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Augustine of Canterbury in the South English Legendary — couplets

BodAsh43.First Lines:
SEyn Austyn þat cristendom broȝte in to
                    engelondeRiȝt is among oþer iwis þat be
                    vnderstonde…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…Nou bidde we ȝerne seynt Austyn þat to crisendom ous
                    brouȝteþat we mote to þe Ioie come to wam our lord ous
                    boȝte

Bod779.First Lines:
Seint austin þat cristindom brouȝte in to
                    ingelonderyȝt is a mon oþer I wis þat he be
                    ondirstonde…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…& graunt vs þat we mote after oure endyng daycome to
                    þe ioye of heuene þat lasteþ euere & ay

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
SEint Augustin þat cristendom brouhte in to EngelondeRiht is
                    among oþere i wis þat we him vndurstonde…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Nou bidde we ȝeorne seint Austin þat to cristendom vs
                    brouhteÞat we mote to þe Ioye come to whom vr lord vs bouhte.
                    Amen.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             The Early South-English Legendary.
EETS
         o.s. 87 (1887; repr. 1987): 24-5 (lines 1-34 only).

BodLauMis108.First Lines:
…Þo he to þe yle cam to Seint Austyn he
                    sendeÞat he to him with his felawes to don is erende
                    iwende…
BodLauMis108.Last Lines:
…Bidde we ȝeorne seint Austin þat cristindom so
                    brouȝteÞat we moten to þulke Ioye come to ȝwan ore
                    louerd us bouȝte
BodLauMis108.Note:
Begins imperfectly due to lost folio between 30 and 31 (stub, numbered
                    30*, remains); missing lines 1-36.
BodLauMis108.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             The Early South-English Legendary.
EETS
         o.s. 87 (1887; repr. 1987): 24-5.

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
SEint Austyn þat Cristendom brought into EngelondeRight is
                    among oþer y wis þat he beo vnderstonde…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…Nou bidde we ȝerne seint Austyn þat to Cristendom vs
                    broughtþat we mote to þe ioye come to whom oure lord vs
                    bouȝte

BodTan17.First Lines:
SEint Austyn þat cristindom brouȝte first in to
                    IngelondRiȝt it is a mong oþere I wis þat he be
                    vndirstond…
BodTan17.Last Lines:
…To seint austin & to alle hise a riȝt fair
                    wonyngeþe king ȝaf in to þe toun of douere to sein in here
                    prechinge

OxfTri57.First Lines:
Seint austyn þat cristendom broȝte into
                    engelondeRiȝt ys among oþere y wis þat he be
                    vnderstonde…
OxfTri57.Last Lines:
…Now bidde we ȝerne seint austyn þat to cristendom vs
                    broȝteþat we to þe ioie come to wham oure lord him
                    boȝte

CULEe215.First Lines:
SEynt Austyn þat brought crystyndam in to ynglondRyght it ys
                    þat amonge other holi men þat he be vnder stonde…
CULEe215.Last Lines:
…Nowe prey we to seynt awstyn þat vs to crystyndam
                    broughtThat we may come to that ioye þat oure lord vs to
                    bought

CamCCC145.First Lines:
Seint Austin þat cristendom broȝte into
                    engelondeseiȝt is among oþer iwis þat he beo vnder
                    stonde…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…Nou bidde we ȝerne seint austin þat to cristendom us
                    broȝteÞat we to þe ioie come to wan oure louerd us
                    boȝte
CamCCC145.Editions:
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS
         o.s. 235 (1959), 236 (1956); repr. 1967: 1.214-17.

CamKC13.First Lines:
SEint Austin þat brouȝte cristendom to EngelondeRiȝt
                    is a mong oþere þat he be vnderstonde…
CamKC13.Last Lines:
…Seint Austyn brouȝte cristendom þus to EngelondeWel
                    hauȝte we his dai holde ȝif we were wel vnderstonde

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
Seint Austyn þat brouȝte cristendom to EngelondeRiȝt
                    is þat among oþere he beo vnderstonde…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Now bidde we ȝeorne Seint Austyn þat vs to cristendom
                    brouȝteÞat we to þe ioye come to whuch oure lord vs
                    bouȝte

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: SEint austin þat cristendom brouȝte in to englondriȝt is among oþer ywis þat he be vnþerstonde…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …nou bidde we ȝerne seint austin þat to cristendom ous broȝteþat we to þe ioie come to wham oure lord ous bouȝte
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum xliiii” added to left margin by later hand (f. 87v).

BLHar2277.Last Lines: …Nou bidde we ȝurne Seint Austin þat to cristendom ous brouȝteþat we to þe ioye come to whan oure louerd ous bouȝte

TokyoTak54.First Lines:
Seynt Austyn þat Cristendom brouȝt to engelondeRight it
                    is amongis oþer þat he be vnderfonge…
TokyoTak54.Last Lines:
…Now preye we god and seint Austyn þat to cristendome vs
                    brouȝtÞat we mowe come to þe ioye to which our lord vs
                    bouȝt
